creator.name: Maatschappij ter bevordering van het godsdienstig onderwijs onder de slaven en kleurlingen Suriname / Haagsche Maatschappij
creator.name_english: Society for the benefit of religious education among slaves and coloureds in Suriname / Haagsche Maatschappij
creator.his_func: The Governor-General of the Netherlands West-Indian Possessions recognized the Society in June 1828. The founders in the West wanted to establish a department of the central board in The Hague. The small collection in the National Archives of The Hague belonged to the vice-president of this department, J.D. Janssen. Another name was the "Haagsche Maatschappij".
creator.notes: See also the description of the "Maatschappij ..." in the "Repertorium van Nederlandse zendings- en missie-archieven 1800-1960".
